sn55.36:4.1: “Mendicants, when someone has four things the gods are pleased and speak of what they have in common.
sn55.36:4.3: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.36:4.6: There are gods with experiential confidence in the Buddha who passed away from here and were reborn there. They think:
sn55.36:4.7: ‘Having such experiential confidence in the Buddha, we passed away from there and were reborn here. That noble disciple has the same kind of experiential confidence in the Buddha, so they will come into the presence of the gods.’
sn55.36:5.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching …
sn55.36:5.3: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.36:5.5: There are gods with the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones who passed away from here and were reborn there. They think:
sn55.36:5.6: ‘Having such ethical conduct loved by the noble ones, we passed away from there and were reborn here. That noble disciple has the same kind of ethical conduct loved by the noble ones, so they will come into the presence of the gods.’
sn55.36:5.7: When someone has four things the gods are pleased and speak of what they have in common.”
